'''Magby''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ブビィ''' ''Buby'') is a {{type|Fire}} [[baby Pokémon]] introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Magmar}} starting at [[level]] 30, which evolves into {{p|Magmortar}} when [[trade]]d holding a [[Magmarizer]].

==Biology==
Magby is a bipedal Pokémon that has a red body with a yellow, flame-shaped marking on its stomach. Its head is covered with large lumps, and it has a rounded, yellow beak. There is a single spike on its back and it has a tapered tail. Its short arms have three clawed fingers, while its feet have only two clawed toes. Magby can breathe 1100&nbsp;°F (600&nbsp;°C) flames, and hot embers drip from its mouth. Its health is determined by these flames. Yellow flames show that a Magby is in good health, while flames mixed with a lot of smoke show that it is fatigued. Magby normally lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Mountain Pokémon|volcanic craters}}. However, it [[PK07|can be seen]] living in towns.

==In the anime==
[[File:Roland Magby.png|thumb|left|250px|Magby in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
[[File:Magby Egg.png|left|thumb|A Magby {{pkmn|Egg}} in the anime]]
===Major appearances===
A Magby is one of the [[Pichu Brothers]]' friends. It appeared in ''[[PK07|Pikachu and Pichu]]'', ''[[Trouble in Big Town]]'', ''[[SS006|Of Meowth]] [[SS007|and Pokémon]]'', ''[[SS009|Big Meowth]]'', ''[[SS010|Little Dreams]]'', and ''[[Pichu Bros. in Party Panic]]''; and it also made a brief cameo appearance in ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]''.

A Magby appeared in ''[[EP262|You're A Star, Larvitar]]''. A {{pkmn|Trainer}} named [[Satchel]] was trying to get it to evolve into {{p|Magmar}} for the [[Silver Conference]] and eventually succeeded. It reappeared in [[EP263|the next episode]], where it was part of an {{p|Unown}}'s dimension.

{{OBP|Tommy|AG015}}, a student of the [[Pokémon Trainers' School]] in [[Rustboro City]], was {{pkmn|training}} with a Magby in ''[[AG015|Gonna Rule The School!]]''. Tommy used Magby during a battle against {{an|Max}}, who was training a {{p|Poliwag}}.

A Magby appeared in ''[[DP170|An Elite Coverup!]]'', under the ownership of [[Roland]]. It had been captured by {{TRT}}, who tricked Roland into thinking they could help raise it and evolve it.

===Minor appearances===
A Magby appeared in ''[[AG010|You Said a Mouthful!]]'', under the ownership of {{OBP|Anthony|AG010}}. It was kept inside {{p|Pelipper}}'s beak to use its attacks to defeat Pokémon, which included [[Ash's Taillow]] and a Trainer's {{p|Zigzagoon}}.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Magby appeared in ''[[AG159|Off the Unbeaten Path]]'', where it was seen participating in the [[Pokémon Orienteering]].

A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Magby appeared in ''[[DP146|Dressed for Jess Success!]]'', where it was seen participating in the {{to|Lilypad}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

A Trainer's Magby appeared in ''[[DP160|A Marathon Rivalry!]]'', where it was seen participating in the [[Pokéathlon]] held in [[Camellia Town]].

A Magby appeared in ''[[M20|I Choose You!]]'', where it was playfully chasing a {{p|Chikorita}}.

A Magby will appear in [[M21]], under the ownership of a Trainer.

==In the manga==
[[File:Whitney Magby Golden Boys.png|thumb|200px|Magby in [[Pokémon Gold and Silver: The Golden Boys]]]]
[[File:Day-Care Couple Magby Cleffa Adventures.png|thumb|left|200px|Magby in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Magical Pokémon Journey manga===
[[Kiaraway]], a Trainer who specializes in collecting Fire-type Pokémon, owns a Magby. It is seen once in ''[[PPP50|Vulpix and Cyndaquil]]''.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Magby is one of the baby Pokémon that escape from the Daycare Center near [[Goldenrod City]] in ''[[PS107|Gligar Glide]]''.

Later in ''[[PS121|Off Course with Corsola]]'', a Magby was seen as one of the Pokémon {{adv|Crystal}} captured and sent to {{adv|Professor Oak}} via the Portable Transfer System.

In ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]'' a Magby was one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]].

Pearl fights several Magby at [[Fuego Ironworks]] left behind by [[Team Galactic]] in ''[[PS384|Maddening Magby]]''.

A Magby appeared in a picture in ''[[PAORAS04|Omega Alpha Adventure 4]]''.

===In the Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys manga===
[[Whitney]] owns a Magby in [[Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys]].

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
A Magby appears in ''[[PM074|Clefairy Becomes a Father...?!]]'' along with its evolved form where it took on {{p|Cleffa}}.

==Trivia==
* Magby has the lowest possible maximum Performance in any given stat of any Pokémon, only capable of reaching 3 stars in any of its five stats.
* Magby has the lowest base {{stat|Defense}} of all {{type|Fire}} Pokémon.

===Origin===
Magby seems to be a combination of a {{wp|booby}} or {{wp|duck}} with a mythical {{wp|Salamander#Mythology|salamander}} of fire. The spike on its back gives resemblance to a baby {{wp|iguana}}.

====Name origin====
Magby is a combination of ''magma'' (intrusive molten rock) and ''baby'' or ''booby''.

Buby may be a combination of ''{{wp|booby}}'' (a type of sea bird) and ''baby''.
